heading: Is Mayonnaise gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Mayonnaise and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Mayonnaise is generally considered safe for individuals with coeliac disease as it is primarily made from egg yolks, oil, and vinegar, which are gluten-free. However, cross-contamination during preparation or the use of gluten-containing additives can pose a risk.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Mayonnaise can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Mayonnaise is gluten free?

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
